channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: Default
item.description: Argentina’s debt restructuring tests the theoretical limits of chaos theory. Gregory Makoff's feat is to build his narrative as a thriller without losing the detailed facts valued by specialists.

item.title: The shocking $4.7 billion ruling against the NFL could disrupt the balance of power between the league and its teams
item.description: The NFL has kept its members happy by signing massive TV deals that makes everyone rich.

item.title: Conundrum Cubed: Scope 3 for Financials
item.description: Proxy data and estimates are likely to play an important role in plugging disclosure gaps in financial institutions' Scope 3 emissions.

item.title: A loophole in U.S. tariffs on Chinese EVs has allowed a flood of golf cart imports, and domestic producers are asking Biden for help
item.description: “Chinese import volumes have rapidly increased, taking greater consumer vehicle market share while using price benefits from Chinese government subsidies to drive their advantage.”

item.title: Hedge Funds: A Poor Choice for Most Long-Term Investors?
item.description: By allocating to a diversified pool of hedge funds, many institutional investors are unwittingly reducing their equity holdings.

item.title: The owner of Redbox DVD kiosks just filed for bankruptcy, saying results ‘failed to meet management’s expectations’
item.description: Chicken Soup for the Soul Entertainment—the seller of self-help books, film and television content—filed for Chapter 11 protection in Delaware late Friday.

item.title: Did Inflation Kill the CAPM?
item.description: While the immediate future may not be promising for the equity premium, it looks bright for factor premiums.

item.title: Astronauts aren’t stranded on the space station, NASA says, while troubleshooting on Boeing’s Starliner capsule continues
item.description: It's now three weeks and counting for Butch Wilmore and Suni Williams as NASA and Boeing troubleshoot equipment problems.

item.title: Behavior of Crowds not Wisdom of Crowds
item.description: When behavioral crowds are roiling the markets, as they are now, best idea active equity has an excellent chance of outperforming.

item.title: Execs should urge workers to return to the office to help San Francisco, Fed president says
item.description: "Talk about what you need to fix and also encourage your people to come back to work," San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said.
